meanings.definition: Giving a false or misleading impression
meanings.sent1: The magician's delusory tricks amazed the audience.
meanings.sent2: Her delusory promises led to disappointment.
meanings.sent3: The delusory mirage in the desert fooled the weary travelers.
meanings.sent4: His delusory claims of being a superhero were quickly debunked.
meanings.sent5: The delusory appearance of the haunted house scared the children.

meanings.definition: Tending to create a false belief or impression
meanings.sent1: The delusory advertisement made unrealistic claims.
meanings.sent2: His delusory stories often confused his friends.
meanings.sent3: The delusory prank caused laughter among the group.
meanings.sent4: The delusory fog obscured the path ahead.
meanings.sent5: The delusory painting seemed to come to life under the dim light.

meanings.sent1: Her delusory behavior worried her family.
meanings.sent2: The delusory patient believed he was a famous actor.
meanings.sent3: The delusory dream left him feeling disoriented.
meanings.sent4: The delusory conspiracy theories spread quickly online.
meanings.sent5: The delusory mind created a world of fantasy and illusion.
